articles.excerpt: The location and hosts have been revealed for the event.
articles.summary:
The Anime Awards will be back in Japan next year in 2024. 
 
The company has announced that the eighth edition of the Anime Awards will take place in Tokyo, Japan on March 2, 2024. The live ceremony will be held at the Hotel Shin Takanawa, bringing together creators, musicians, and performers at the event.
 
 Anime Awards 2024 hosts


Voice actress Sally Amaki and entertainer Jon Kabira will be returning as hosts for the Anime Awards in 2024. Sally Amaki, a member of the digital voice actor idol project 22/7 (Nanabun no Nijuni), is known for her work as the English and Japanese voice of Carol Olston in Tomo-chan Is a Girl!.

articles.title: Crunchyroll Anime Awards regresará a Tokio en 2024
articles.excerpt: Sally Amaki y Jon Kabira regresarán como los anfitriones de la gala que premia a lo mejor del mundo de los anime
articles.summary:
Crunchyroll anunció hoy que la octava edición de los 'Crunchyroll Anime Awards' regresará a Tokio, Japón, el 2 de marzo de 2024 con una ceremonia en vivo para honrar a los creadores, músicos y artistas que impulsan la animación japonesa conocida como anime.

La conducción de los premios estará a cargo de la actriz de doblaje de voz Sally Amaki y el presentador Jon Kabira, quienes estarán regresando como anfitriones de la pasada edición.

Amaki es miembro del Nanabun no Nijuni, una colaboración entre Sony Music y ANIPLEX, así como la voz en inglés y en japonés del personaje Carol Olston en 'Tomo-chan Is a Girl'.

best anime comedies

articles.title: Gen Z Watches More Anime Than Any Other Generation
articles.author: Renee Senzatimore
articles.excerpt: According to a recent data, Gen Z's love of anime supersedes that any previous generation, with over 65% of Zoomers tuning in to watch.
articles.summary:
The results are in - Zoomers watch more 
anime
 than any other generation.
 
As detailed on 
Anime Dork
, YourDictionary recently utilized its WordFinder function to determine which generation was most actively engaged in the anime community. Based on a sample size of 1,000 users, Gen Z has the highest percentage of anime fans, with over 69% stating that they watch it. This number is nearly 10% higher than millennials, just below Gen Z at 57%. Gen X has the third-highest viewership, with a modest 40%.

articles.title: Does Anime Get A Pass For Being Original?
articles.author: invalid@example.com
articles.excerpt:
Compared to the West, there seems to be a new anime every six months, give or take.

The West when it comes to Hollywood seems to be rehashing, remaking, or rebooting almost anything from the past. Not to mention making sequels or prequels.

However, Japan often makes a lot of new content and...
articles.summary:
Anime is varied, so much that as an anime fan you just don't like everything that "looks anime", just like Metal music genre.



There are tons of new anime each quarter (season) and there's always one genre dominating for which there are good and bad stories, there are fans, haters, etc. Inside anime fans communities.



Anime is so big that it's just so different going from one story to the other and even i have ditched series for looking too "light novel-y" but ended up being amazing after I watched it of recommendation.

ufotable

articles.title: Why Even the Most Accurate Live-Action Anime Adaptations Are Inherently Flawed
articles.author: Jennifer Melzer
articles.excerpt: While anime adaptations can bring a manga's story to life in an animated setting, live-action anime adaptations have obstacles they can't overcome.
articles.summary:
Over the years, there has been an overabundance of live-action anime adaptations, exploring everything from 
Dragon Ball
 and 
Death Note
 to 
Bleach
 and the upcoming 
One Piece
 live-action movie. While some aren't absolutely horrible, they definitely don't come anywhere close to touching the anime that inspired them. No matter how hard producers try to make an impact and take advantage of the massive fan followings anime franchises have, they repeatedly fail to impress fans, but why?
 
According to Canadian philosopher Marshall McLuhan's pioneering study from 1964, 
Understanding Media: The Extensions of Man
, "The form of a medium embeds itself in the message, creating a symbiotic relationship by which the medium influences how the message is perceived.

articles.title: Why Do Anime Characters Have Nosebleeds? The Answer Is Kind of NSFW
articles.author: Callie  Cadorniga
articles.excerpt: Why do anime characters' noses bleed so often? The answer is kind of NSFW. Here is everything you need to know about this trope, explained.
articles.summary:
Home
 > 
Entertainment
 > 
Anime
Why do anime characters' noses bleed so often? The answer is kind of NSFW. Here is everything you need to know about this trope, explained.
By 
Callie (Carlos) Cadorniga
Jun. 22 2023, Published 6:01 p.m. ET
Source: A-1 Pictures
'Blend-S'
Anyone who's used to the visual storytelling medium of 
Japanese animation
 is probably used to all of its quirks when it comes to characters expressing themselves. There's the giant sweatdrop for when people feel awkward about a situation, that little veiny cross on their foreheads when they're angry, or sometimes, they'll go full-on chibi whenever they're utterly bewildered by the goings-on around them.

Funimation is a leading streaming service that has been serving the anime community for years, offering a wide range of classic and new releases. In this article, we will explore the history and evolution of Funimation, its streaming service and library, popular anime series available, exclusive partnerships and collaborations, impact on the anime industry, community and fan engagement, subscription plans and pricing, as well as its mobile app and accessibility.

articles.title: 20 Memes From The World Of Anime
articles.author: popcorn
articles.excerpt: For the people who love anime and for the people who love memes, we've compiled the best of both worlds for everyone to enjoy.
articles.summary:
Attention, 
anime
 enthusiasts and 
meme
 connoisseurs! Prepare to be immersed in the vivid and humorous world of "anime memes." These visual treats mix recognizable characters, memorable locations and smart captions to create a meme experience designed just for 
otaku
 culture. Anime memes capture the essence of our favorite anime episodes and characters, from the ludicrous to the realistic.

KC Global Media, a leading multi-territory operator of linear TV channels in Asia, has recently sold Animax Korea to Aniplus, an Asian multinational television channel and anime distributor based in Singapore and South Korea. The deal, which was agreed upon in April, aimed to elevate Animax Korea's offerings while focusing on horizontally integrating its content across Aniplus' platform and reach. The sale was subject to regulatory approvals, which have now been obtained.

Anime's continued rise in popularity in the world is arriving in some unexpected places. With celebrities like Michael B. Jordan and John Boyega sharing their love of anime, even musicians find themselves falling in love with the medium. Megan The Stallion has shared her love of all things anime more times than we can count, and now, the musicians of the band Coheed And Cambria haven't just shared their top ten anime series, but have also created a new music video using an anime influence.

articles.title: 15 Best Light Novels Turned Into Anime Series
articles.author: Maria Remizova
articles.excerpt: Many light novels are responsible for some of the best stories in anime, including the romance Toradora! and the slice-of-life Spice & Wolf.
articles.summary:
The sources anime turn to for inspiration are not limited to manga series and original concepts. Another favored originator for anime series is the wonderfully multifaceted world of light novels, or ranobe, a type of Japanese young adult fiction that goes hand-in-hand with anime and manga. Light novels skyrocketed in popularity in recent years, impacting the trends that spread wide over the entire medium.
 
It's likely that even if fans have no idea where their favorite anime originated from, some of these stories came directly from ranobe.

articles.summary:

Lalu setelah light novel makin populer dibuat anime season pertamanya pada tahun 2018. Kadokawa bersama dengan Studio Anime Lerche melanjutkan untuk membuat season kedua yang tayang pada Juli 2022.

Bagi yang belum mengetahui anime ini menceritakan sebuah sekolah elite SMA Ikusei Kodo, yang memiliki standar akademis yang tinggi dan menghasilkan beberapa alumni yang sukses di dunia pendidikan maupun pekerjaan.
